role.description: As a Manager, one can create/modify/delete buckets including managing retention policy, configuring IP addresses. In addition, one can upload and download the objects in the bucket.

actions.description: View the location and storage class of a bucket.

List all buckets in a service instance.

Copy (write) an object from one bucket to another.
List the IDs of encryption root keys associated with a bucket.

Unsupported operation - used for S3 API compatibility only.
Internal use only - unsupported for users.
List all the objects in a bucket.
List all active multipart uploads for a bucket.
Add/Update a public access block configuration for a bucket.

Copy (read) an object from one bucket to another.

Unsupported operation - used for S3 API compatibility only.

Remove public access block configuration for a bucket.

role.description: As a manager, you have permissions beyond the writer role to complete privileged actions as defined by the service. In addition, you can create and edit service-specific resources.
As an administrator, you can perform all platform actions based on the resource this role is being assigned, including assigning access policies to other users.

actions.description: The ability to update or edit existing policies.
The ability to create a policy that can be delegated to another service.
The ability to delete existing policies.
The ability to assign roles to policies.
